messages: b06cd993038dd41d93226c063ab71871 (18:57): As usual, i got some cpu to spare if anyone wants something rendered.

62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (18:58): Recently I saw a thread on Elysiun about polygonal hair (it was a girl's head with blue hair).. Can't find it anymore :( Can somebody refer me to that thread please?
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:04): ShortWave, hello
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:04): ShortWave, how is it going? Haven't seen you for a while here
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:08): http://feed.stashmedia.tv/storage/codehunter.jpg
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:08): can somebody help me with such materials please?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:10): You're joking

dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:10): After 3 months of harassing people, you're *still* not actually thinking about how such materials are put together and applying that analysis to your methods?
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:10): ShortWave, why would I joke? I was asking how are you doing..
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:11): I ignored that.

dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:11): What I can't ignore tho, is the simple fact that you've apparently not yet learned how to analyze a material and duplicate it effectively based on your observations.
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:12): and they aren't exactly hard materials to reproduce
e2b61875db20485741662517e4b9454d (19:13): ShortWave: is there any article about that?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:16): Pitel: about using your head?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:18): Pitel: IN truth, there are entire BOOKS written on the subject of texturing, both with image-based textures and procedural textures.
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:21): ShortWave, could you recommend some book please?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:22): motorsep-work: I suggest you check your logs, because I'm 110% certain I've at least twice mentioned two different books on the subject to you.
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:22): ShortWave, It was about Renderman
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:22): How can I get blender i686, instead of 386?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:22): motorsep-work: Contraire.
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:23): ShortWave, hm?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:23): motorsep-work: I definitely recall several instances where I mentioned a specific book to you.
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:23): Or can I compile Blender with some funky option for i686?
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:23): Jimmey__: there's likely a compile flag somewhere
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:24): Jimmey__: And it's PROBABLY compile-system dependent, i.e. if you're using makefiles or Scons, etc.
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:24): ShortWave, ok
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:24): leave the 386 alone unless you actually know what you are doing
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:24): ShortWave, you've lost me now - I don't do much ( any ) compiling

dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:25): Like when you were looking for blurred anisotropic reflections and were upset because you couldn't speed them up, which is really just a demonstration of how little you understand about the topic to begin with.
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:25): timmeh, I don't mind using the 386 version, I just wondered if I could get a 686 version - If I did, would there be any benefit?
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:26): Jimmey__, not with straight off the shelf compile options
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:27): timmeh, 386 it is. Thanks.
a69a8157963ab511bdf38662c6796081 (19:27): how would a person move a material (such as one in the sonixcarmateriallibrary.blend) to another .blend?
a2de65b279a972972e834b857b95ae2a (19:28): puke2, append it. You can append a material from one .blend to another, and then select that material from the list of materials, assigning it to the object.
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:28): yes File Append (Shift+F1
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:29): browse to the .blend and browse in material directory or other...
16655781f1e7ac174240c3a594c5147e (19:31): http://www.jpg.com")
a69a8157963ab511bdf38662c6796081 (19:31): what would I append it to, an object?
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:34): ShortWave, you r right. I am designer, not technician :) And I have to know more about materials, I agree, more technical stuff, how it works, etc.
a69a8157963ab511bdf38662c6796081 (19:35): another easy question, after you rotate an oject, how do u apply that rotation so that alt-r does not change it back?

62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:36): ShortWave, but one old designer, back in time, told me, that it's not about re-inventing a bike. It's about getting all stuff that is out there already and applying it in right direction.
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (19:37): ShortWave, that's why I would rather have something, that already have been out there and use it, instead of trying to re-invent it..
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:39): motorsep-work: And?
